page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: This is a rural block with its three main residential areas sited in North Yorkshire and Durham County. The border of the counties is the River Tees which separates the villages of Croft on Tees and Hurworth Place. The third village of Dalton on Tees, which is in North Yorkshire, is the only one which is growing in size. Much of the land is used for agricultural purposes in forestry, grain,rape,dairy farming,roots,pigs, beef and sheep, with facilities for fishing and shooting. A number of residents retired here but there is a cross-section of all ages in the area. Although there are not a lot of recreational facilities in the area, Brownies and Guides meet weekly in Croft, and the W.I. meets monthly at Dalton.
